name: WP Site Screenshot
author: Midnay

sections.description:
WPSite Screenshot plugin helps you to easily capture screenshot of the pages of any website. It could be used for showing portfolio, or design collection etc… Just provide the site URL and you are all good to go. You can categorize and manage the screenshots as you wish and can be displayed in front end with a shortcode. You can also export the data in the plugin as JSON file and can be imported as required. This plugin is helpful to showcase multiple sites in a single platform.

Features

ADD NEW SITE
Add the title and the site url of the website, you wish to take the screenshot. By default, home page screenshot will be taken. By publishing the post, featured image will be automatically set to the home page of the website. You can also set the category of the site, if needed.

ADD NEW CATEGORIES
Add new categories for grouping up the screenshots captured.

CONFIGURE SETTINGS
1. Export all the data added with the plugin as a JSON file.
2. Import the json file whenever needed.
3. Set the pagination count which limits the number of displays on front end.
4. Enable target blank to open up the website in a new tab.

SHORTCODES
use shortcode [wpsst_site_display] to display the contents on frontend.

Version

1.0
sections.installation:
1. Extract the plugin archive file.
  2. Upload the ‘wp-site-screenshot’ folder to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory.
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
sections.faq:
Does the screenshot listed direct us to that page?

Yes, the screenshot listed in front end will direct us to that page.

What is target blank enable option?

If we enabled the checkbox, the site will be opened in a new tab otherwise it will be opened in the same tab itself.

What is export and import settings?

We can export all the data added with the plugin as a json file. We can import the same data to any other websites.

Does this plugin work with newest WP version and also older versions?

Yes, this plugin works really fine with WordPress 5.2!
It also works great with previous wordpress versions.The best practice is to run the latest WordPress version for a lot of reasons.
